explainability.path_to_improvement: Document how explanations are provided to users affected by AI decisions.

external_accountability.path_to_improvement: Obtain external validation of AI practices or require vendor certifications.

fairness.path_to_improvement: Document bias testing procedures or vendor AI fairness requirements.

governance.findings: Case studies mention AI/ML driving solutions and data analysis within systems. These materials also highlight AI capabilities such as intelligent agents and predictive/prescriptive analytics.
governance.path_to_improvement: Name an AI governance body with defined mandate covering all AI use.

relevant_sources.summary: This Workday case study on Arrow Electronics' AI-Driven Learning Platform provides limited evidence for responsible AI. While it mentions the AI's capability to suggest content for employee visibility and development, this is presented as a benefit rather than a documented policy or operational execution, thus offering weak support for the governance and transparency pillars.
relevant_sources.title: Arrow Electronics AI-Driven Learning Platform Case Study

relevant_sources.summary: This case study on Arrow's CARES system provides evidence for **governance** and **transparency**. The document implies governance and transparency by mentioning AI/ML driving solutions and data analysis within the system. While it highlights AI capabilities like intelligent agents and predictive/prescriptive analytics, it lacks specific operational or policy details to fully substantiate these pillars.
relevant_sources.title: Arrow Customer Automated Replenishment System (CARES)

oversight.path_to_improvement: Document human review processes for AI-assisted decisions (built or vendor AI).

privacy.path_to_improvement: Document data protection practices for AI systems, including vendor AI data handling.

transparency.findings: Published materials mention the use of AI tools and capabilities, including perception, navigation, planning, AI modules, and algorithms. Case studies also reference AI/ML driving solutions, data analysis, intelligent agents, and predictive/prescriptive analytics within systems.
transparency.path_to_improvement: Publish detailed documentation (model cards, system specs) for AI systems deployed.

relevant_sources.summary: This press release announces the Arrow Electronics Robotics Center of Excellence, which demonstrates AI systems integration and implementation. The source provides evidence for the **transparency** pillar by mentioning the use of AI tools and capabilities like perception, navigation, and planning, as well as AI modules and algorithms. This implies transparency in the tools and services offered, though it lacks specific operational or policy details.
relevant_sources.title: Arrow Electronics Robotics Center of Excellence

relevant_sources.summary: This Workday case study on Arrow Electronics' AI-Driven Learning Platform provides limited evidence for responsible AI. While it mentions the AI's capability to suggest content for employee visibility and development, this is presented as a benefit rather than a documented policy or operational execution, thus offering weak support for the governance and transparency pillars.
relevant_sources.title: Arrow Electronics AI-Driven Learning Platform Case Study

relevant_sources.summary: This case study on Arrow's CARES system provides evidence for **governance** and **transparency**. The document implies governance and transparency by mentioning AI/ML driving solutions and data analysis within the system. While it highlights AI capabilities like intelligent agents and predictive/prescriptive analytics, it lacks specific operational or policy details to fully substantiate these pillars.
relevant_sources.title: Arrow Customer Automated Replenishment System (CARES)

summary.overall_findings: Drawing from 6 publicly available sources, Arrow Electronics' published materials address 2 of 7 evaluated responsible AI pillars. Transparency disclosures mention the use of AI tools and capabilities, including perception, navigation, and planning, as well as AI modules and algorithms. For governance, case studies highlight AI/ML driving solutions and data analysis within systems, alongside capabilities such as intelligent agents and predictive/prescriptive analytics. No qualifying public evidence was found for the majority of the 7 evaluated pillars.
